content.description:
P1. Climb a ramp till you can traverse left onto a steep wall with thin cracks. Follow the cracks to a roof. Here, hand traverse out left of a roof, climb up onto easier terrain, and build an anchor (150 feet, 5.8).

P2. Climb easy terrain to the top (150 feet, 5.5).

Descent: hike off the north side.
content.protection: A single rack to 4" with doubles of 0.75-2" is helpful.
content.location: Located on the 3rd Amigo (the farthest one back), this route starts just right of huge roof system on a ramp with a big tree at the base.

content.description:
P1. Climb cracks in prominent, right-facing corner. Go up easy terrain to a roof with a chimney to the right. Build an anchor just before roof (200 feet, 5.5).

P2. From here, make delicate moves out right to a chimney (crux), and climb mainly on the left side of it (this climbs like a corner) past a run-out, and build an anchor on easier terrain (200 feet, 5.8-).

P3. Climb up into chimney, and pop out on easy ramp that leads to the top (100 feet, 5.5).

Descent: hike off the east side.
content.protection: A single rack with doubles of 0.2"-3".
content.location: On the left side of the First Amigo, start at the base of slab with a crack that leads to a roof with a chimney system to the right.

content.description: Climb the corner with good hand jams to the obvious roof. There are 2 different cracks you can use to pull the roof. (The crux) The one on climber's left is easiest. Enjoy hand and fist jams to the top.
content.location: This formation sits on top of the first amigo. Climb the First Amigo to the top. Once you are at the top, begin walking off like normal while looking uphill. The formation and route is very obvious.

content.description:
P1. Climb a right-facing flake system to a ledge. Traverse the ledge to belay, 5.5, 50' (the same start as

Portugal

).

P2. Climb out left to a crack system that ascends up the center of wall with a small roof in the beginning. Climb through roof, and belay on a foot ledge with a good horizontal crack, 5.7, 100'.

P3. Climb thin cracks up and slightly right. When the cracks seams up, make a techy move to gain another crack system. Follow this to easier terrain. Belay on a good ledge, 5.7+, 140'.

P4. Follow a weakness to the top, 5.5, 60'.
content.location: Start at a weakness below a big roof system on the First Amigo.

content.description:
P1. Climb a right-facing flake to a series of right-trending cracks. Build an anchor on a ledge, 5.6+, 100'.

P2. Climb a weakness/left-facing corner system. When in doubt, step left and and climb on highly featured face holds. At a ledge, step right, and climb through one last steep section. Belay on easy terrain (this could be done in two pitches, 200', 5.7+.

P3. Climb the path of least resistance to the top, 50', 5.4.

Descent: walk off
content.protection: A single rack 00-4" and doubles of 0.3"-2".
content.location: This is in the center of First Amigo.

content.description:
P1. Follow cracks and flakes to a steep section. Climb through, and belay on ledge, 80', 5.9.

P2. Climb a right-facing corner up to thin cracks. Follow them to a thin hand crack (crux) then past a few hollow flakes to a nice belay perch below some roofs, 100', 5.9+.

P3. Climb through roofs, and follow easy terrain to top, 5.8, 50'.

descent: walk off
content.protection: A single rack 00"-4" and doubles of 0.3-2".
content.location: It is in the left center of the Second Amigo.

content.description:
P1. Climb a right-facing flake (the same start as

Red October

) to a ledge. Follow a weakness to a roof, and traverse right around it. Follow cracks to a good belay pedestal, 5.8, 120'.

P2. Climb a thin crack (crux) to easier terrain, then continue up an offwidth. Follow cracks to a good belay ledge, 5.9-, 100'.

P3. Climb cracks to a weakness/groove. Climb to a ledge. Surpass one more steep crack to a good belay ledge, 5.6+, 100'.

P4. Climb easy terrain to the top, 5.4, 30'.

Descent: walk off.
content.protection: A single rack 00"-4" and doubles of 0.3"-2" (a 5" piece is optional).
content.location: Start at a right-facing flake located in the center of the First Amigo.

content.description:
P1. Climb an easy flake system to a ledge, and traverse left, 5.6, 50'.

P2. Traverse left from the belay to a wall with many vertical cracks. Climb cracks on the left side of this wall near the arete. Build a belay on a pedestal, 5.7, 100'.

P3. Follow cracks up and slightly right past an abundance of amazing face holds, and make a balancy move to gain a groove. Follow this to a good belay ledge, 5.7, 100'.

P4. Step right, and climb weakness to the top, 5.5, 50'.

Descent: walk off.
content.protection: A single rack 00"-4" and doubles of 0.3"-2".
content.location: Start on a weakness/flake system on the right side of a wall just below a big roof system.

content.description:
P1. Climb a series of hand-size cracks up a steep wall just right of an arête. Build an anchor on easier terrain (150 feet, 5.8+).

P2. Climb easy terrain to top. It is more exciting and exposed if you go up and left from belay (100 feet).

Descent: walk off the north side. It might be wise to rope up for one short 5.4 step across.
content.protection: A single rack to 4" with doubles of 0.75-2".
content.location: This is located on the south face of the 2nd Amigo just to the right of the arête.

content.description:
P1. Climb thin cracks for a 120'. When 15' below roof, traverse right to a nice belay ledge, 120', 5.9.

P2. Climb cracks and great features through the center of a roof (the crux), and continue up a weakness to the top,110', 5.10.

Descent: walk off to the north.
content.protection: A single rack 00"-4" with doubles of 0.3-1".

content.description:
P1. Start on the first pitch of

Paydirt

at the roof. Keep traversing right to ledge at base of huge, left-facing corner, 80', 5.7.

P2. Climb a corner for 60'. When rock quality deteriorates about 20 feet below a roof, make an exciting traverse out right on good crimps (crux), and ascend a flake to a good belay stance, 100', 5.7+.

P3. Continue up moderate terrain to the top, 120', 5.6.
content.protection: A single rack to 5", a 6" piece is optional, and doubles of 0.2"-2".
content.location: This route is located on the First Amigo and ascends up a up the obvious, left-facing corner system.

content.description:
P1. Climb a thin crack to a few flakes. When the flakes end, step right to a finger crack, and follow it to a belay ledge, 100', 5.8.

P2. Follow easy cracks to a right-facing corner. Build an anchor just after the roof, 100'. 5.7.

P3. Climb easy terrain to shallow, left-facing corner, then climb a seam to a ledge with a horizontal crack in it. Belay here, 5.8, 150'.

P4. Climb easy terrain to the top, 5.4, 50'.

Descent: walk off.
content.protection: A single rack to 4' with doubles of 0.3"-2".
content.location: This route is located on the left side of The First Amigo.

content.description:
P1. Climb the first pitch of

Climb 63

, 100', 5.8.

P2.  From the belay, step right around the corner, and climb up and right on good holds. Follow a crack past some fragile rock to a roof, step right through the weakness, and follow an easy crack to a steeper hand/fist crack. Then climb to ledge with bolted anchor, 100', 5.9+.
content.protection: A rack with singles 00-4" and doubles 0.2-3".
content.location: On the far left side of First Amigo, climb path of least resistance through a wild roof system to splitter cracks above.

content.description:
P1. Climb up a hand crack to gain an arete. Here, follow a flake system up through a water groove to a big ledge, 100', 5.8.

P2. D

o a few techy moves off the belay to gain a series of wild holds. Climb them to a steep crack above, and follow an easy crack to a bolted anchor, 100', 5.9+.
content.protection: A rack with singles 00-4" and doubles 0.2-1".
content.location: On the far left side of the First Amigo, climb the arete.
